intro: Matelea cornejoi, commonly known as the Mexican moonflower, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its large, showy white flowers that open at night and emit a fragrant scent to attract pollinators. Its leaves are typically heart-shaped and have a velvety texture. Matelea cornejoi is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is also used in traditional medicine.
